BCR (Age of Sigmar) [6,000pts]

  • **Pitched Battle** 2,000 (Destruction - Beastclaw Raiders) [6,000pts]

    Rules: At the Double, Forward to Victory, Inspiring Presence

    • Leader [1,220pts]

      • Frostlord on Stonehorn [420pts]

        Categories: DESTRUCTION, Ogor, STONEHORN, BEASTCLAW RAIDERS, MONSTER, HERO, Frostlord, Leader, Behemoth

        Command Abilities: Bellowing Voice, Damage Table: Stornhorn: 00-03 Wounds, 04-05 Wounds, 06-08 Wounds, 09-10 Wounds, 11+ Wounds, Unit: Frostlord on Stonehorn, Unit Abilities: Earth-shattering Charge, Stone Skeleton, Weapon: Frost Spear, Frostlord's Punches and Kicks, Stornhorn's Crushing Hooves, Stornhorn's Horns


        Command Abilities Command Ability Details Ref
        Bellowing Voice With his booming voice the Frostlord signals the hunt. If a Frostlord uses this ability then until your next hero phase you can re-roll all charge rolls for friendly BEASTCLAW RAIDERS units that are within 14" when they charge.

        Frostlord on Stonehorn *1393+
        Unit Abilities Ability Details Ref
        Earth-shattering Charge If a Frostlord on a Stonehorn is within 12" of any enemy models at the start of your charge phase, it must attempty to charge, even if it ran in the movement phase. After this model completes its charge move, pick an enemy unit within 1"; that unit suffers D6 mortal wounds.
        Stone Skeleton Halve the Damage characteristic (rounding up) of weapons that target this model. In addition, halve the number of mortal wounds this model suffers from a spell or ability (rounding up). Battletome: Beastclaw Raiders Official Errata, July 2018 p1

      • Huskard on Stonehorn [320pts]

        Selections: 1. Nothing Left Standing, 2. Battered Talisman, 2. Gleaming Blade, 4. Lightshard, 5. Tokens of Everwinter, Chaintrap, General

        Categories: DESTRUCTION, OGOR, STONEHORN, BEASTCLAW RAIDERS, MONSTER, HERO, Huskard, Leader, Behemoth, Artefact, General

        Artefact: Battered Talisman, Gleaming Blade, Lightshard, Tokens of Everwinter, Command Trait: Nothing Left Standing, Damage Table: Stornhorn: 00-02 Wounds, 03-04 Wounds, 05-07 Wounds, 08-09 Wounds, 10+ Wounds, Unit: Huskard on Stonehorn, Unit Abilities: Earth-shattering Charge, Line-breakers, Stone Skeleton, Weapon: Huskard's Punches and Kicks, Stornhorn's Crushing Hooves, Stornhorn's Horns, Weapon: Chaintrap


        Artefact Artefact Details Ref
        Battered Talisman Roll a dice each time you allocate a mortal wound to the bearer. On a 5+, the mortal wound is negated. General's Handbook 2017
        Gleaming Blade Pick one of the bearer’s melee weapons to be a Gleaming Blade. Allocate wounds inflicted by that weapon before allocating wounds inflicted by any other attacks made by the bearer. If 1 or more wounds are inflicted on an enemy unit by that weapon, heal 1 wound allocated to the bearer.
        Lightshard If the bearer is slain, before removing the model, roll a dice for each enemy unit within 6" of them. On a 3+ that unit suffers 1 mortal wound.
        Tokens of Everwinter Once during the battle, in any hero phase, the bearer can swallow the Tokens of Everywinter. If he does, until the start of the next hero phase you can re-roll all hit rolls, wound rolls and save rolls made for him.
        Command Trait Command Trait Details Ref
        Nothing Left Standing In your hero phase, pick a terrain feature that is within 6" of your general and at least 5 other friendly DESTRUCTION models. That terrain feature no longer gives cover to models that are in or on it. General's Handbook 2017 p156
        Damage Table: Stornhorn MoveHorn AttacksCrushing Hooves Ref
        00-02 Wounds 12"62+
        03-04 Wounds 10"53+
        05-07 Wounds 8"43+
        08-09 Wounds 6"34+
        10+ Wounds 4"24+
        Unit MoveWoundsBraverySave Ref
        Huskard on Stonehorn *1284+
        Unit Abilities Ability Details Ref
        Earth-shattering Charge If a Huskard on a Stonehorn is within 12" of any enemy models at the start of your charge phase, it must attempty to charge, even if it ran in the movement phase. After this model completes its charge move, pick an enemy unit within 1"; that unit suffers D6 mortal wounds.
        Line-breakers After a Huskard on a Stonehorn attacks in the combat phase, you can pick a MOURNFANG PACK within 10". That unit immediately pile in and attack if it is within 3" of the enemy and has not already attacked this phase.
        Stone Skeleton Halve the Damage characteristic (rounding up) of weapons that target this model. In addition, halve the number of mortal wounds this model suffers from a spell or ability (rounding up). Battletome: Beastclaw Raiders Official Errata, July 2018 p1
        Weapon TypeRangeAttacksTo HitTo WoundRendDamage Ref
        Huskard's Punches and Kicks Melee1"33+4+-1

        Stornhorn's Horns Melee2"*4+3+-23
        Weapon: Chaintrap Missile12"14+3+-3

      • Huskard on Thundertusk [360pts]

        Selections: 3. Luminary Rod, 3. The Pelt of Charngar, 4. Bellowing Blade, 5. Guardian's Coronet, Chaintrap, Huskard's Punches and Kicks, Thundertusk's Crushing Blows

        Categories: DESTRUCTION, Ogor, THUNDERTUSK, BEASTCLAW RAIDERS, MONSTER, HERO, Huskard, Leader, Behemoth, Artefact

        Artefact: Bellowing Blade, Guardian's Coronet, Luminary Rod, The Pelt of Charngar, Blizzard-speaker: Winter's Endurance, Winter's Strength, Damage Table: Thundertusk: 00-02, 03-04, 05-07, 08-09, 10+, Unit: Huskard on Thundertusk, Unit Abilities: Blasts of Frost-wreathed Ice, Blizzard-speaker, Numbing Chill, Weapon: Huskard's Punches and Kicks, Thundertusk's Crushing Blows, Weapon: Chaintrap


        Artefact Artefact Details Ref
        Bellowing Blade When the bearer is picked to fight, you can re-roll one failed wound roll for bearers attacks in that fight for each enemy HERO that was within 12" of the bearer when they were picked to fight. General's Handbook 2017
        Guardian's Coronet Once per battle, at the start of your hero phase, the bearer can call upon the guardian spirits. If they do so, until your next hero phase, roll a dice each time you allocate a wound to the bearer. On a 4+ the wound is negated.
        Luminary Rod Once per battle, pick a point on the battlefield within 9" of the bearer that is visible to them and draw an imaginary straight line 1mm wide between that point and the closest part of the bearer. Each unit other than the bearer that has models passed across by this line suffers D3 mortal wounds.
        The Pelt of Charngar Roll a dice at the start oif each of your hero phases. On a 1, 2 or 3 the bearer of the Pelt of Chargnar heals 1 wound, but on a 4, 5 or 6 he heals D3.
        Blizzard-speaker Ability Ref
        Winter's Endurance A second skin of ice forms on the unit as it is rimed with a healing frost. One model in the unit heals D3 wounds.
        Winter's Strength Winter winds howl through the unit, chilling their blood and lending them strength. You can reroll wound rolls of 1 for the unit until the start of your next hero phase.
        Damage Table: Thundertusk MoveFrost-Wreathed IceCrushing Blows Ref
        00-02 8"6 mortal wounds2+
        03-04 7"D6 mortal wounds3+
        05-07 6"D3 mortal wounds3+
        08-09 5"D3 mortal wounds4+
        10+ 4"1 mortal wound4+
        Unit MoveWoundsBraverySave Ref
        Huskard on Thundertusk *1284+
        Unit Abilities Ability Details Ref
        Blasts of Frost-wreathed Ice In the shooting phase, pick a unit within 18" that is visible to the Thundertusk. Do not use the attack sequence for an attack made with Frost-wreathed Ice. Instead roll a dice. On a 1, nothing happens. On a 2+, the target unit suffers the number of mortal wounds shown on the damage table. Battletome: Beastclaw Raiders Official Errata, July 2018 p1
        Blizzard-speaker In your hero phase, a Huskard on a Thundertusk can attempt to harness the strange wintery magic that clings to his mount. To do so select a BEASTCLAW RAIDERS unit within 18" and roll a dice. Add one to the result for each other friendly THUNDERTUSK unit within 19" of the unit you picked. On a 4 or more, select on of the abilities from the list below to apply to the unit you picked.
        Numbing Chill Your opponent must subtract 1 from any hit rolls that target this model in the combat phase.
        Weapon TypeRangeAttacksTo HitTo WoundRendDamage Ref
        Huskard's Punches and Kicks Melee1"33+3+-1
        Thundertusk's Crushing Blows Melee2"43+*-1D3
        Weapon: Chaintrap Missile12"14+3+-3

      • Icebrow Hunter [120pts]

        Selections: 3. Luminary Rod, 4. Bellowing Blade, 5. Guardian's Coronet

        Categories: DESTRUCTION, OGOR, BEASTCLAW RAIDERS, HERO, Icebrow Hunter, Leader, Artefact

        Artefact: Bellowing Blade, Guardian's Coronet, Luminary Rod, Unit: Icebrow Hunter, Unit Abilities: Icy Breath, Masters of Ambush, Mighty Throw, Weapon: Great Throwing Spear, Hunter's Crossbow, Hunter’s Culling Club


        Artefact Artefact Details Ref
        Bellowing Blade When the bearer is picked to fight, you can re-roll one failed wound roll for bearers attacks in that fight for each enemy HERO that was within 12" of the bearer when they were picked to fight. General's Handbook 2017
        Guardian's Coronet Once per battle, at the start of your hero phase, the bearer can call upon the guardian spirits. If they do so, until your next hero phase, roll a dice each time you allocate a wound to the bearer. On a 4+ the wound is negated.
        Luminary Rod Once per battle, pick a point on the battlefield within 9" of the bearer that is visible to them and draw an imaginary straight line 1mm wide between that point and the closest part of the bearer. Each unit other than the bearer that has models passed across by this line suffers D3 mortal wounds.
        Unit MoveWoundsBraverySave Ref
        Icebrow Hunter 6"775+
        Unit Abilities Ability Details Ref
        Icy Breath Instead of attacking with his missile weapons in your shooting phase, an Icebrow Hunter can unleash his icy breath. If he does so, pick a visible unit within 6" of the Icebrow Hunter and roll a dice; on a 4 or more that unit suffers D3 mortal wounds as its warriors are frozen solid.
        Masters of Ambush Instead of setting up this model on the battlefield, you can place him to one side and say that he is set up in ambush. In any of your hero phases, you can set him up on the battlefield more than 9" from any enemy models. This is his move for the following movement phase.
        Mighty Throw An Icebrow Hunter can make an attack with his Great Throwing Spear even if he made a run move in the same turn. Furthermore, if he does so, the Damage inflicted by the Great Throwing Spear is increased from D3 to D6, and its range from 9" to 18"
        Weapon TypeRangeAttacksTo HitTo WoundRendDamage Ref
        Great Throwing Spear Missile9"14+3+-1D3
        Hunter's Crossbow Missile12"14+3+-D3
        Hunter’s Culling Club Melee1"44+3+-2

    • Battleline [460pts]

      • Mournfang Pack [140pts]

        Selections: 2 Mournfang Pack [140pts], Gargant Hacker, Ironlock Pistol (Skalg Only)

        Categories: DESTRUCTION, OGOR, BEASTCLAW RAIDERS, Mournfang Pack, Battleline

        Unit: Mournfang Pack, Unit Abilities: Banner Bearer, Horn Blower, Iron Fists, Mournfang Charge, Weapon: Gargant Hacker, Ironlock Pistol (Skalg Only), Mournfang Tusks


        Unit MoveWoundsBraverySave Ref
        Mournfang Pack 9"664+
        Unit Abilities Ability Details Ref
        Banner Bearer Models from this unit may carry Raiding Banners adorned with the skull of a great beast. You can re-roll dice rolls of 6 when taking battleshock test for a unit that includes any Raiding Banners. Furthermore, roll a dice whenever an enemy model flees whilst its unit is within 6" of any Raiding Banner from your army. On a 6, another model immediately flees form that unit.
        Horn Blower Models in this unit may be Horn Blowers.You can roll three dice and pick the two highest results when determining the charge distance for a unit if it includes any Horn Blowers.
        Iron Fists Each time you make a successful save roll of 6 or more for a Mournfang Pack armed with Iron Fists, and the attacking unit is within 1", the attacking unit suffers 1 mortal wound after all of its attacks have been made
        Mournfang Charge Each time a Mournfang Pack model completes a charge move, select an enemy model within !". On a roll of a 4 or more, that model suffers a mortal wound.
        Weapon TypeRangeAttacksTo HitTo WoundRendDamage Ref

In addition, whilst the Frost Sabres are within 16" of a friendly ICEBROW HUNTER they have a Bravery of 7 rather than 5.

        A Hardy Breed Add 1 to Braggoth’s Wounds characteristic.
        Fierce Rivals You can add 1 to hit rolls made for any BEASTCLAW RAIDERS unit from this battalion whilst it is within 6" of an IRONJAWZ unit from this battalion, and vice versa.
        Overrunning Stampede Once per battle, at the end of any of your combat phases, this battalion can make an Overrunning Stampede. When it does so, each unit in this battalion that charged successfully this turn can immediately pile in and attack again, in an order of your choice.

        Gore-Grunta Charge Even by the destructive standards of the IRONJAWZ, a Gore-Grunta charge is horrific to behold, enemy units vanishing under a roaring, grunting mass. However, a Grunta needs a bit of a run-up to really get going! When you declare a charge with a unit of Gore-Gruntas, measure the distance to the nearest enemy unit. If the distance is 8" or more and the charge is successful, the gruntas’ Fanged Maw and Hooves have a Damage characteristic of D3 instead of 1 until the end of that turn.
        Horn Blower Models in this unit may be Horn Blowers.You can roll three dice and pick the two highest results when determining the charge distance for a unit if it includes any Horn Blowers.

You can re-roll dice rolls of 6 when taking battleshock test for a unit that includes any Raiding Banners. Furthermore, roll a dice whenever an enemy model flees whilst its unit is within 6" of any Raiding Banner from your army. On a 6, another model immediately flees form that unit.
        Earth-shattering Charge If a Frostlord on a Stonehorn is within 12" of any enemy models at the start of your charge phase, it must attempty to charge, even if it ran in the movement phase. After this model completes its charge move, pick an enemy unit within 1"; that unit suffers D6 mortal wounds.
        Horn Blower Models in this unit may be Horn Blowers.You can roll three dice and pick the two highest results when determining the charge distance for a unit if it includes any Horn Blowers.
        Iron Fists Each time you make a successful save roll of 6 or more for a Mournfang Pack armed with Iron Fists, and the attacking unit is within 1", the attacking unit suffers 1 mortal wound after all of its attacks have been made
        Line-breakers After a Huskard on a Stonehorn attacks in the combat phase, you can pick a MOURNFANG PACK within 10". That unit immediately pile in and attack if it is within 3" of the enemy and has not already attacked this phase.
        Mournfang Charge Each time a Mournfang Pack model completes a charge move, select an enemy model within !". On a roll of a 4 or more, that model suffers a mortal wound.
        Stone Skeleton Halve the Damage characteristic (rounding up) of weapons that target this model. In addition, halve the number of mortal wounds this model suffers from a spell or ability (rounding up). Battletome: Beastclaw Raiders Official Errata, July 2018 p1
        Weapon TypeRangeAttacksTo HitTo WoundRendDamage Ref
        Beastriders Punches and Kicks Melee1"64+4+-1

    • Allegiance

      • Allegiance

        Selections: Beastclaw Raiders

        Categories: Allegiance

        Battle Trait: Beastclaw Stampede, The Everwinters Blessing, Everwinter Result: 1-2, 3-4, 5, 6


        Battle Trait Battle Trait Details Ref
        Beastclaw Stampede On a turn in which they charge into combat, you can re-roll all wound rolls of 1 made for BEASTCLAW RAIDER models in the combat phase.
        The Everwinters Blessing Roll a dice at the start of each of your hero phases to determine the effects of Everwinter's Blessing on the battle (reference table for result)
        Everwinter Result ResultDescription Ref
        1-2 Fortifying HoarfrostYou can re-roll save rolls of 1 for all friendly BEASTCLAW RAIDER models until the start of your next hero phase
        3-4 Freezing TailwindsAll friendly BEASTCLAW RAIDERS models can immediately move 3" as if it were the movement phase (they cannot run or retreat as part of this move).
        5 Deadly FrostbiteRoll a dice for each enemy unit within 3" of at least one of your BEASTCLAW RAIDERS models. On a 6 that unit suffers D3 mortal wounds.
        6 Raging BlizzardRoll a dice for each enemy unit within 3" of at least one of your BEASTCLAW RAIDERS models. On a 6 that unit suffers D6 mortal wounds.

    • Malign Sorcery [90pts]

      • Endless Spell: Emerald Lifeswarm [50pts]

        Categories: ENDLESS SPELL, EMERALD LIFESWORM, GHYRAN, Malign Sorcery

        Spell: Summon Emerald Lifeswarm, Unit Abilities: Bounteous Healing, Empowered by Ghyran, Fly, Predatory


        Spell Casting ValueDescription Ref
        Summon Emerald Lifeswarm 6If successfully cast, set up an Emerald Lifeswarm model wholly within 15" of the caster.
        Unit Abilities Ability Details Ref
        Bounteous Healing After this model is set up or after it has moved, pick 1 unit within 1" of it. You can either heal D3 wounds that have been allocated to that unit or, if no wounds are currently allocated to the unit, you may return a number of slain models to it that have a combined Wounds characteristic equal to or less than the roll of a D3.
        Empowered by Ghyran If your battle is taking place in the Realm of Life, roll a D6 to determine the number of wounds healed or wounds worth of slain models returned by the Emerald Lifeswarm’s Bounteous Healing ability.
        Fly This unit can fly.
        Predatory An Emerald Lifeswarm is a predatory endless spell. Emerald Lifeswarms can move up to 10" and can fly.

      • Endless Spell: Shards of Valagharr [40pts]

        Categories: ENDLESS SPELL, SHYISH, SHARDS OF VALAGHARR, Malign Sorcery

        Spell: Summon Shards of Valagharr, Unit Abilities: Empowered by Shyish, Ensnaring Soul-drain, Twilight Translocation


        Spell Casting ValueDescription Ref
        Summon Shards of Valagharr 5If successfully cast, set up the first Shards of Valagharr model wholly within 6" of the caster, and then set up the second Shards of Valagharr model wholly within 12" of the first.
        Unit Abilities Ability Details Ref
        Empowered by Shyish If your battle is taking place in the Realm of Death, the first Shards of Valagharr model can be set up wholly within 12" of the caster, instead of 6".
        Ensnaring Soul-drain At the start of the movement phase, draw an imaginary straight line 1mm wide between the closest parts of the bases of the two Shards of Valagharr models from this endless spell. Each unit passed across by this line is ensnared until the end of that turn. Halve the Move characteristic of a unit that is ensnared. In addition, subtract 1 from hit rolls for attacks made by units that are ensnared.
        Twilight Translocation At the start of the battle round, after determining who has the first turn, the players must roll off. The winner can remove one Shards of Valagharr model from this endless spell from the battlefield and set it up again anywhere on the battlefield wholly within 12" of the other Shards of Valagharr model from this endless spell.

    • Command Points [500pts]

      • Purchased Command Points [500pts]

        Selections: 10x 1 Command Point [500pts]

        Categories: Command Points

    • Scenery [100pts]

      • Scenery: Penumbral Engine [100pts]

        Categories: PENUMBRAL, PENUMBRAL ENGINE, SCENERY, STORMVAULT

        Unit Abilities: Deteriorating State, Repercussion of the Necroquake


        Unit Abilities Ability Details Ref
        Deteriorating State At the start of each battle round after the first, roll a dice. On a 1-4 nothing happens. On a 5 or 6 the function that currently applies to all PENUMBRAL terrain features is replaced with the other function (see ‘Repercussions of the Necroquake’).
        Repercussion of the Necroquake At the start of the first battle round, after determining who has the first turn, roll a dice and consult the table on the right to determine which function all PENUMBRA terrain features on the battlefield gain for the duration of the battle.

        1-3: Orrey of Obfuscation: Re-roll save rolls of 1 for attacks that target units wholly within 12" of any Penumbral terrain features.

        4-6: Orrey of Illumination: At the start of your hero phase, you receive 1 extra command point if any friendly HEROES are within 12" of any PENUMBRAL terrain features.

Force Rules

At the Double: You can use this command ability after you make a run roll for a friendly unit that is within 6" of a friendly HERO, or 12" of a friendly HERO that is a general. If you do so, the run roll is treated as being a 6. (Core Rules p3)

Forward to Victory: You can use this command ability after you make a charge roll for a friendly unit that is within 6" of a friendly HERO, or 12" of a friendly HERO that is a general. If you do so, re-roll the charge roll. (Core Rules p3)

Inspiring Presence: You can use this command ability at the start of the battleshock phase. If you do so, pick a friendly unit that is within 6" of friendly HERO, or 12" of a friendly HERO that is a general. That unit does not have to take battleshock tests in that phase. (Core Rules p3)

Selection Rules

Gore-Grunta Boss: The leader of each unit is a Gore-grunta Boss. They make 4 attacks rather than 3. ()

Orruk Gore-Gruntas: A unit of Orruk Gore-Gruntas has 3 or more models. The riders of some units of Gore-Gruntas are armed with Pig-iron Choppas, while others carry Jagged Gore-hackas. Their mounts tear at the enemy with their Fanged Maws and Hooves. ()
